body_text.text: The coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome 2 (SARS-8 CoV-2) virus has been declared a pandemic by the World Health Organization (WHO) (1) . It spread at an 9 accelerated rate in densely populated regions such as NYC which is considered an epicenter.

We explored concordance/discordance rates between patients and support persons. Among 26 SARS-CoV 2 infected patients, 23/28 (82.1%) support persons were infected. However only 16/171 27 (9.4%) support persons were infected when patients tested negative. Importantly COVID negative 28 patients had COVID positive support persons 6.2% of the time. (Table 1)

FIGREF1.text: Mount Sinai Health System, we began to care for pregnant women with COVID -19 in 12 March of 2020. In April 2020 a policy was implemented to perform universal SARS-CoV 2 testing for 13 women planning to deliver within the Mount Sinai Health system, as well as their designated support 14 persons so as to inform obstetric and neonatal practices. 15 16 During the testing interval of April 4-15, 2020, 307 asymptomatic women presenting in labor to 17 two institutions within Mount Sinai Health System, underwent SARS-CoV 2 testing. Among the 307 18 women tested, 50 SARS CoV-2 infections were detected. The prevalence of asymptomatic infection in 19 this group was 50/307 (16.3%). Among these women 91 did not have a support person present. Of the 20 remaining 216 support persons 17 declined testing leaving 199 available for testing. All support persons 21 were administered an infectious screening tool upon entry and all screened negative (2). Of these 199 22 support persons who underwent SARS-CoV 2 testing 39 were infected with a prevalence of 19.
